alert.note: Alert for Clay (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 12:04PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dale, Henry, northeastern Coffee and Clay Counties through 100 PM EDT/NOON CDT/... At 1204 PM EDT/1104 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Gaino to 10 miles north of New Brockton. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Midland City, Newton, Ariton, Pinckard, Kinsey, Grimes, Newville, Napier Field, Bellville, Haleburg, Shorterville, Hooper Stage Field, Hayes, Pecan and Thomas Mill Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
